definition.p: A bug report is a collection of bug patterns and notes resulting from the execution of a test script. Each test case step that can result in a reportable bug has one or more patterns for reporting that bug. The tester chooses a pattern and fills in any missing or enhancing information. Each completed pattern is included in the bug report. In cases where there is no adequate pattern, the tester creates a pattern-like entry for the report.

partsAndFunctions.p: Here are the parts of a bug report:

tr.td: Name of tester, software tested, date, test script id
CPU type and speed, operating system
List of bug patterns describing the failures encountered while testing
Number of the test case and step where failure occured
List of actions taken to trigger the failure
A short description of the "normal" outcome of the actions
How the behavior deviated from expectations.
